key_points: Prince Philip was disappointed by Prince Harry quitting royal duties but understood his grandson’s frustrations with the media.
Philip strongly disapproved of Harry and Meghan's interview with Oprah Winfrey, calling it “madness”.
Harry returned to the U.K. for Philip's funeral without Meghan, who is pregnant and remained in California.
Philip was not upset about the interview airing while he was hospitalized; he was more concerned about the couple's public airing of personal grievances.
Philip believed in the importance of not focusing on oneself and advised his family against seeking popularity.
Philip was proud of Harry's military service and his appointment as Captain General of the Royal Marines.
The decision for Harry and Meghan to step back from senior royal duties was agreed upon by the queen, Charles, and William due to their desire for independent careers and philanthropy.
The interview with Oprah aired grievances against the royal family, including accusations of racism and neglect.
The upcoming funeral service for Philip at St. George’s Chapel, Windsor Castle, will spotlight Harry's interactions with the royal family.
Observers are curious about the potential for reconciliation between Harry and the royal family, especially with his brother William.
